rComments: Don't listen to those negative comments. This professor is one of the best in the department. He makes the course content very interesting, gives amazing chalkboard lectures. The exam tests you on lecture material and the style is similar to the homework and quizzes. He stays after the lecture every time to answer questions and is always helpful

A weaker professor in Elec Engineering. He went over time every class and often confused the class on what should be simple concepts. Textbook has many mistakes and poorly fits material. I recommend only going to the tutorial and seeing the past tests (lots of repeat q's).

Everyone likes to complain about Herman but seriously, compared to people like Jacobsen and Sousa, he really isn't too bad. Very approachable, and his notes, while not perfect, are much easier to understand than Sousa's for instance. Although it is jarring having to write full lab reports, it is what some other schools do right from first year.

Thankfully Optics is a commonly taught course so extra resources are readily available with a single Google search. Herman has terrible notes, stumbles repeatedly during lectures, and recommends a terrible textbook (with quite a few mistakes in the solution manual). Avoid this course if you rely on attending lectures to understand the material.

Notes are disorganized. His way of clarifying concepts are miserable at best. The worst part is the selection of textbook, which hardly fits the syllabus. Personally I found it very difficult to study for this course. Do not recommend this prof.
Unorganized, awful person, not helpful..one of the worst prof

Unorganized. Notes are terrible, tests do not correspond with level of material discussed in class and tutorials. Labs are interesting, but the reports he wants you to write afterwards are ridiculous. He copied the report writing format for scientific reports for his criteria, which actually does not make sense for our lab material.
